en: Maybe it's all the pressure you're under. Maybe it's that you haven't been actually working with your product for a while. Or maybe it's taking a step back and having a grand overview of everything you're working towards. For whatever reason, today you've been seized by a horrific sense of doubt.
Is your product even worth it? Will it provide real, tangible value to the people who buy it? Does the world even need you in it?
It's a terrible time to have a crisis of faith in your work, but here you are. The feeling cripples you.
You wait for the feeling to pass. If doubts came up suddenly, maybe they'll go away just as suddenly.
You do nothing of importance all day, praying you'll feel better in the morning. And you do - mostly. But doubt lingers in the back of your mind.

You discuss it with Skylar, who gives you a rousing speech about what a good idea it is and what kind of people it will help. Then you agree to a hug and a pleasant night in to take your mind off of things. By the next day, everything is back to normal.
